listing.listing_description:
So rare a home, this urban hideout sets the scene for a stay to remember. This home is ideal for the indulgent family or group of friends looking for the city stay in one of Dubai’s most vibrant neighborhoods. Located in the heart of City Walk, this home is a stone’s throw from the major attractions of the neighborhood.

The design scheme has a Cosmopolitan approach to accent the grand scheme of the home. Without the coldness of most loft style apartments, comfort is at the focus. Contrasting materials come together to inspire a feeling of belonging that is signature to the design team behind it all. 

The living space opens into the dining and kitchen to create a large communal area where most of the action goes down. Blonde wood flooring adds warmth throughout the space. A small guest bathroom and fully equipped laundry room are at the entrance. The defining feature of the living space is a large floor to ceiling windows that boast views of Burj Khalifa and the occasional star gaze. Abstract artworks and vintage prints compliment the soft fabrics and wood furniture. The dining table is fit for a midsummer night's dream level dinner. 

The modern kitchen is fitted out with major appliances and sleek countertops. Open plan in structure, the fully accessorized kitchen is equipped for an elaborate cooking session. A classic Nespresso Machine lives here with complimentary capsules that come with every check in. Additional seating is at the kitchen countertop that doubles as a bar. The main entertainment area is just off the dining area with a massive L shape sofa. A flat screen 55-inch smart tv and sound bar promise a memorable night in with the pre-programmed Netflix for our Guests. 

On the ground floor is a cozy bedroom with an ensuite bathroom for the guest who wants to be close to the action.

Up the wood and glass staircase one finds two modern bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms. The master bedroom is of eclectic design with textured headboards, a print dyed armchair, and small work station for the work/play balance. The queen size bed faces a smart TV placed to enjoy a movie before bed. Floor to ceiling windows overlook the main City Walk boulevard and views of Dubai. The bathroom is a minimal stand in shower. The second bedroom is just off the first with a more classic take on design - also with a queen size bed. A small balcony can be opened during cooler seasons. All linens are 400 thread count Egyptian Cotton that are freshly laundered pre-arrival. Fluffy towels are in abundance. Acqua Di Parma also makes a guest appearance from Parma Italy as an added luxury.

listing.listing_description:
Discover the hidden charms of Paros at Villa Drazen. Set on a quiet hillside near the town of Ambelas, the sun-drenched villa has views over the terraced landscape to the Aegean Sea. A traditional mix of whitewashed and stone walls and three bedrooms, including one in a separate guest house, provide an enchanting setting for a romantic getaway or family vacation.

The heart of the villa is a large, sunny terrace with ocean views, an L-shaped infinity pool and plenty of daybeds and chairs for lounging. A covered pergola with a dining table is a shaded spot for al-fresco meals. Other outdoor features include a gas barbecue, shower, built-in sitting area and a second-floor balcony. Inside, the villa has a sound system and Wi-Fi for entertainment and a wine cellar to house your newly discovered Greek vintages.

As you’d expect from a home on the Greek islands, the interiors of Villa Drazen have airy whitewashed walls and cool marble floors, with some wood-beamed ceilings adding natural texture. In the living room, neutral-toned sofas, a decorative fireplace and Moroccan-style accents create an atmosphere that’s both serene and cozy. The adjacent dining area, which seats eight, has a large picture window looking out to the pool and ocean, and opens to the terrace. Just beyond the dining area, the fully equipped kitchen has warm brick and cream cabinets and a practical island layout.

There are two bedrooms in the main house at Villa Drazen and one in a separate guest house. Each bedroom has a double bed and en-suite bathroom with shower. In the main house, there’s one bedroom on the ground floor and one bedroom upstairs, which opens to the balcony. The guest house has its own kitchenette and sitting area in addition to the bedroom.

During your stay, have a swim in the Aegean at Contaratos Beach, 5 km away, or Santa Maria Beach, 8 km away. Villa Drazen is 5 km from the town of Naoussa, 13 km from the port of Parikia, 14 km from the town of Paros, and 26 km from the town of Alyki. If you’ll be flying to or from Paros, the island’s national airport is about a 16 km drive from the villa.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Sun, sea and sparkling white walls: all the charm of the Greek islands is on full display at Nautilos. This traditionally inspired Mykonos vacation rental boasts sweeping views of Agios Ioannis Bay and a location close to shopping, local tavernas, and Mykonos Town. Reserve its four bedrooms for a getaway with a few other couples, a holiday with extended family or even a sun-kissed island honeymoon.

Succulent plantings and local stone create a private setting for the villa's pergola-covered sitting and dining areas, sunny lounge area and swimming pool overlooking the sea. A wood-fired barbecue makes it easy to prep and serve dinner outdoors; if you'd prefer to spend the evening inside, the television and Wi-Fi are ready to entertain.

Inside Nautilos, details like white stucco walls and beamed ceilings lend a certain romance to the living and dining areas and the fully equipped kitchen. The rooms flow from one to the other, connected by archways, and open to the terrace so you can let the sea breezes in. Vintage nautical instruments, model ships and lanterns used throughout are further nods to the waterfront setting.

There are three bedrooms in the main house of this luxury property and one in a guest studio; all four have en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning. In the main house, there are two bedrooms with double beds and one bedroom with two twin beds. The guest-house bedroom has a double bed.

Though Nautilos itself is in a beautiful spot, it's also just a short drive from the gorgeously clear waters of Kapari Beach and the lively tavernas of Agios Ioannis. You'll find shopping close at hand, but for a wider range of boutiques, restaurants and clubs, all amid incredibly photogenic traditional architecture, make the drive into Mykonos Town.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Located on the most beautiful oceanfront on the isle of Mykonos, Kyma villa makes a great bet for a family or a group of friends seeking some Mediterranean fun in the sun. Ftelia Beach is renowned for being one of the longest sandy beaches on the island and is particularly popular for windsurfing. Within this idyllic setting, Kyma distinguishes itself, just a few steps above the beachfront with a view across the bay over the Aegean.

The outdoor spaces at this stunning vacation rental have been developed on two interconnected levels. The contoured, infinity-edge swimming pool provides the optical illusion of almost blending its waters with those of the sea. The alfresco living areas are shaded by an ample pergola on the upper level of the terrace, while cast iron furnishing and a lovely wooden dining table allow for outdoor cocktails and cuisine any time of the day. With an exterior bar, an outdoor sound system piping tunes and sun loungers, Kyma is perfect for the consummate entertainer.

A defined maritime theme combined with tasteful decor indoors create a stunning private retreat without compromising the more typical elements of Cycladic architecture, such as the cimentogonia used in the flooring and bathrooms. Cool white spaces and contemporary furnishings provide that quintessential Mykonos vibration. The upper level hosts the living room and kitchen, both of which have direct access to the terrace.

The five elegant bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms at this non-smoking villa are split between the two levels, accommodating up to ten guests. All of the suites provide air conditioning and ceiling fans. You will find double beds in four suites and ocean views in three. Get the rest and relaxation you deserve with Luxury Retreats!

Kyma makes a great choice for guests looking for an island property just on the beach, complemented by fresh interior decoration and modern amenities. Beach access is via a stone staircase from the deck of the villa. This coveted location and setting has also made Kyma an ongoing destination for fairytale bay weddings and other special events. What are you celebrating?

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Experience the very finest in beachfront access at this premium coastal palace, located in one of Dubai’s most central neighborhoods. With a huge rooftop deck, cool rooms, pool and spacious driveway, guests can relax in privacy, complete a real touch of Gulf glamour. Arrive to next-level comfort after a long flight, and look forward to exploring Dubai’s cosmopolitan downtown and pristine beaches.

Step into air-conditioned freshness the moment you pass through the doors of this coastal villa, with the famous heat of Dubai sliding off you as the polished wooden floors, tasteful decor and ornate, Arabian windows of the property stretch in front of you. Kick off the day in the cooler mornings with a delicious breakfast on the shaded balcony, as the waves lap up to touch the golden sands of the beach opposite the property. At any point, the villa’s refreshing pool is there for a rejuvenating dip, while the comfortable living areas, complete entertainment system and sheer space of the property ensures that both kids and adult groups can enjoy things in their own style. Finally, take pleasure in wholesome group meals at the expansive formal dining table or outdoor seats.

Kite Palace is ideally located for those looking to experience all the best aspects of modern Dubai. The city’s famous beaches are literally on the doorstep, with renowned Kite Beach being just a handful of steps away. Here, guests can indulge in swimming and sunbathing, with diverse watersports outings and a kids play-area all on offer. The villa is just a handful of minutes by car from the waterparks and stunning hotels of the Palm Jumeirah district, while the jaw-dropping skyscrapers and world-renowned shopping of the central district are easily accessible. As the day cools down, make the straight-forward trip back to the villa and savor a cool drink on the balcony as the city’s lights glow along the coastline.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Watch as windsurfers navigate the shimmering waters of Ftelia Bay from this modern-Cycladic home in Mykonos. Catch up on some reading underneath the shade of the dining pergola while the kids splash around in the swimming pool. Then, sit back on a lounge chair as the sunsets beyond the distant mountains. In the morning, wake up early for a windsurfing lesson on Ftelia Beach.

 Flow between the main house, guest house, and multi-level terrace as freely as the sea breeze. Along the way, appreciate the natural elements of wood and stone that decorate and support the villa white stucco walls. Let the charcoal barbeque and fully-equipped kitchen inspire you to try your hand at traditional Greek cuisine. Then, dine alfresco, sipping wine as the stars begin to shine.

 If you’re keeping up with a fitness routine, the home gym is ready for you. After a workout, cool off in the pool or treat yourself to a Turkish bath and a soak in the hot tub. Not ready for any action yet? Throw a log on the fire and stretch out on the sofa while you stream something new on Smart TV. Now that your batteries are recharged, turn up the sound system and rally the troops for a wild night on the island.

 In the mood for seafood? Visit Alefkantra, better known as “Little Venice,” where colorful houses and incredible restaurants line the coast. On your way, stop in for a picture at the Mykonos Windmills, you’ll probably recognize them from all the postcards. For a deeper dive into the island’s history, check out the Archaeological Museum of Mykonos, known for their collection of unique vases, sculptures, and ceramics.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Perched at the edge of a lush nature reserve, this villa boasts sea views overlooking the island of Naxos. Famous Cycladic architect Kostas Gouzelis brings together a minimalist approach to the interior with expansive outdoor space. It’s surrounded by a bountiful fruit orchard, known in the ancient maps of Paros as “the old garden.” Pack a picnic and drive a short, scenic route to Tsoukalia Beach.

Inside, panoramic ocean and mountain vistas can be admired from each room. Modern furniture mixes with Athenian antiques to create a refreshingly eclectic aesthetic. With direct access to the garden from the kitchen, farm fresh fare is mere steps away. Home-grown figs, lemons, apricots, and grapes make for the sweetest desserts or snacks. Under the terrace pergola, set the table for 10 and dine alfresco with nothing but a gentle breeze and the sound of rippling tides. The sun-soaked terrace features a bar where you can sit in the evenings with a G&T or first thing in the morning with a cold-pressed juice. 

Take a break from returning emails in the office space to seek out one of the abode’s secluded areas and dive into a juicy novel. The turquoise-hued infinity pool invites you to cool down on blazing afternoons. A 5-minute drive lands you in Isterni where you’ll have access to authentic Greek cuisine. Plan a day trip to Kolympethres and swim in the crystal clear water, rent an umbrella and lounger, and stop by a quaint café before returning to the undeniable tranquility of Villa Orian.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Poseidon Two is part of a group of three properties freshly inaugurated in the area of Kalafatis Beach, on the southeastern side of Mykonos. The villa grants easy access to the lovely beaches down below which are also a windsurfer’s delight. You can also take a jaunt to Agia Anna, a beautiful small cove. A Greek paradise awaits!

Poseidon Two’s infinity swimming pool offers stunning views over Kalafatis Bay. On the lower level of the house, there is a unique aquarium-style window which actually looks into the pool. The pool level terrace features loads of outdoor lounging and dining spaces in both sun and shade. You can also take a well deserved soak in the hot tub on the upper verandah. A cozy outdoor dining area with a barbeque on the side of the terrace is ideal for alfresco dining. Indoors, you will find satellite television, DVD player, Hi-Fi sound and Wi-Fi access. Your reservation includes daily housekeeping.

Poseidon Two was built with traditional Cycladic architectural design, pristine white surfaces and stone structures. The beautifully furnished lounge room with its adjoining dining area have a stylish atmosphere and soft colors embellish the space. The modern kitchen is well designed and fully functional with all necessary amenities for the culinary genius in the group.

Seven delectable bedrooms accommodate up to fourteen guests at Poseidon Two. All of the bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms, and the one features the aquarium-style window looking into the swimming pool. You will find double beds in all of the bedrooms, and the bunk beds are sure to be a hit with children.

The possibility of visiting some of the lesser known beaches of Mykonos combined with the stylish design of this property make Poseidon Two the perfect spot for groups or families looking to embrace the rich experiences offered by this magical island of the Aegean Sea. The sheer beauty and picturesque environs also make Poseidon Two a favorite spot for exclusive weddings, birthdays and other special events. Inhale the sweet fragrance of geraniums mingled with bougainvillea as you coast your way through the sheer white abodes adorned with turquoise balconies, cloistered in this Greek paradise called Mykonos!

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
From the hills above Agios Ioannis Beach, watch as sailboats navigate the sea on the west coast of Mykonos. Wake up to the ocean view, no matter which bedroom you choose. Spend your afternoon swinging in a hammock, stretched out in a sun lounger, or floating around the pool. For a closer look, walk 4-minutes to the beach. Then, head 4km to Mykonos Town for dinner.

Aura’s Cycladic-style is evident in a glance. White stucco walls, exposed wood, and natural stone deliver the authenticity of the Greek islands. Flow through open concept interiors out wide doorways to the terrace, inviting fresh sea breeze and warm sunlight to fill the villa. Prepare meals in the updated kitchen on marble countertops. And, pamper yourself with the highest-end fixtures in the spa-inspired ensuites.

On hotter days, relax inside with the air conditioning, a good movie on Smart TV, and Wi-Fi. If you’re ready for the heat, work on your tan from one of the sunbeds. After dinner, turn up the wireless sound system, mix a few tropical cocktails, and gather on the terrace lounge. If it looks like it’s going to be a late one, hop in the pool to recharge your batteries or fire up the barbeque for a late-night snack.

If you’d rather hit the town, Skandinavian Bar is the spot to dance until the sun comes up. Don’t feel like dancing? Try out some of Tropicana Beach Bar’s signature cocktails while you dig your feet into the sand of Paradise Beach. For dinner, you’ll find fresh seafood pretty much everywhere, but the Little Venice area is a favorite spot among locals. On the way, stop in for a picture at the windmills.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Updated Cycladic architecture and endless views of the Aegean Sea await at this multi-villa estate on the southern coast of Mykonos. Lay in a sun chair and gaze upon the neighboring islands. Curl up for a movie on the 4-meter projector screen in the home cinema. At night, do some stargazing from the hot tub or take a stroll along Super Paradise Beach, less than 1 kilometer from home.

 Exposed wood, natural stone, and white stucco walls are the trademark styles of the Cyclades, and Dante delivers authenticity. Once inside, take a moment to discover the thoughtfully selected pieces of modern furniture, the expertly designed farmhouse kitchen, and the privacy created by the 3 separate units. Back outside, pick your favorite vantage point on the winding terrace and settle in for the sunset.

 On quiet nights in, sit by the fireplace and catch up on some reading. Keep up with your fitness routine in the home gym. Or get cozy with that special someone in a sunbed. On not-so-quiet nights, fire up the barbecue, crank the sound system and organize a foosball tournament on the terrace, the losers have to jump in the pool.

History buffs in the group will want to check out the windmills on the way to dinner in Little Venice. They are the island’s most recognizable landmark dating back to the 17th-Century. You could also spend an afternoon at the Folklore or Archaeological museums. Later, dance the night away at Cavo Paradiso, the island’s hottest club known for bringing in top DJs.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Notice how the color palette reminds you of the desert sands on which Dubai is built. The creamy sand color mixes with touches of the sun and sea, inside and out of this penthouse. Bespoke décor also reflects desert colors. Wrap around seating areas, textural golds and warm browns in fabrics, furniture, and accessories complement the 360-degree wall to wall glass views of the skyline of Dubai and the Dubai Marina. It’s pure elegance.

Skylight penthouse has a grand viewing deck at the very top of The Palm property. A lovely heated swimming pool dominates the large deck. It’s where private sunning and swimming and having fun all happens. You have a birds-eye view over the white sand beach, swaying palms, and the Arabian gulf below. Bring binoculars to watch the yachts go in and out of the marina. A shaded alfresco dining area and conversation lounges are perfect for meals and snacks after a busy time at the Kids club.

Evenings after dinner when the city skyline is all aglitter, where lights like little faeries twinkle from the yachts, light some lantern lights, and sit out with friends and family to feel the wonder of this magical sparkling place.

The Palm Resort offers many additional amenities. Ask the concierge. The beach is below. Downtown Dubai is 22 km for shopping. It’s 6 km to Dubai Marina and 6.5 km to Emirates Golf Club.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved

listing.listing_description:
Named in loving adoration of the prickliest of plants, The House of Kakti is home to Greece’s largest garden of blooming cacti. This exquisite property in Paros showcases an incredible array of colorful cactus varieties within a secluded locale that offers amazing views of the islands of Ios, Sikinos and Folegandros. Within walking distance from the house, one can choose between the sandy beach of Farangas or a series of scenic rocks interspersed with intimate mini-beaches.

Showcasing classic Cycladic architecture, this stunning vacation rental raises the notion of seamless indoor/outdoor living to a crescendo. The sparkling infinity swimming pool gazes onto the cacti garden. You will also find a pergola with four giant sofas, an ideal spot for sunset drinks or siestas. The House of Kakti has been designed as a summer residence. The dining area is situated outside under a handcrafted pergola and has a beautiful view of the Mediterranean Sea. A barbeque is located in the rear of the house to minimize any unpleasant smoke.

The southern positioning of the house reduces the effect of the Meltemi winds that typically blow from the north during the summer. The main living room is delightfully cozy and complemented by two exterior sitting areas that satisfy the needs of those who prefer being in comfort whilst enjoying the scenic outdoors. Having numerous sitting areas provides extra privacy. A fully equipped kitchen with Miele appliances will ensure flawless execution for the culinary genius in your entourage.

Eight exquisite bedrooms accommodate up to sixteen guests at this non-smoking villa. The main house offers three master bedrooms and two additional bedrooms. The guest house faces the main terrace and includes an additional master bedroom and two large bedrooms. All of the bedrooms include en-suite bathrooms, air conditioning and ocean views.

The House of Kakti is one of the most original properties in the Cyclades and will prove to be a memorable place to spend a tranquil vacation in Greece thanks to its combination of delectable interiors, generous outdoor spaces and stunning array of colors. This area of the island is not heavily populated with tourists, so it has a very local and authentic feeling. We recommend this private luxury home for a family holiday or a special celebration like a wedding, anniversary or birthday.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Situated in glorious seclusion on the southern coast of Mykonos, this villa is a popular choice for those seeking a dream stay in the Cyclades. Take to the sun-drenched patio or dive into the pristine blue pool. Spread over terraced levels, savor the bright, pristine kitchen and seaview balcony, before visiting dream beaches and peaceful villages nearby.

Rest assured that Dolce Vita Mykonos represents an especially private and peaceful location on the island of Mykonos. Sheltered between two hills, the villa commands an enchanting view of the nearby coast. Gentle sea breezes caress the property, cooling the numerous shaded seating areas. Guests can take in the Greek sunlight from the warm stone terrace that runs alongside the impressive pool, or recline with a book or device on the upper level balcony for an even better view of the impressive countryside. The interiors of the home have been outfitted to exacting standards, featuring finely crafted furniture, exposed wooden rafters, soothing light colors and cooling AC to ensure the ideal temperature is always maintained.

This is one of the finest villas for guests looking to make the most of the island’s celebrated beaches. Choose your spot for the day from 7 beaches that all lie within 10 kilometres of this home, ranging from peaceful and secluded strands, to sunny and sandy spots that offer good access to local bars and restaurants. Visit the peaceful laneways and sunny squares of local villages like Ano Mera, relaxing with a cool ice-cream or tasty lunch in one of the many tavernas of the town. The unique geography of the island offers something for everybody, from tackling diving or kite-surfing off the isthmus beach of Omos, to making an offshore trip to the historic ruins of Delos.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Dubai’s newest island, Bluewaters, is where you’ll find the legendary hospitality of Ceasar’s Palace and its triple-ocean-view Julius Suite. Start your mornings on Ceasar’s private beach, walking through the warm sand as the cool tide gently washes over your feet. Getting a relaxing start is a great idea because things like indoor skiing, diving with sharks, and kite surfing are all pretty common in Dubai, or, you could always just hang out on the beach.

Open concept design ensures that the ocean view is ever-present throughout Julius, making it a perfect host for special occasions and group gatherings. The formal dining space has seats for 8, and the balcony is a great spot for post-dinner cocktails. Back inside, the grayscale color scheme of the villa gives off an elegant vibe while the warm wood tones of the divider-walls create a relaxing, natural atmosphere.

Included with your stay, Ceasar’s daily housekeeping, valet, and laundry service will help take away what little stress remains, leaving you with even more time to enjoy Cove Beach, 5 on-site restaurants, and the state of the art gym. And, if you need to sneak away for a bit, drop the kids off with the Empire Club, an interactive space that is sure to keep them entertained.

Dubai is truly a city of limitless possibility. For the adrenaline junkies, everything from sky diving to scuba diving is at your fingertips. Rather keep your feet on the ground? Try for the course record at Emirates Golf Club; it’s a 61 by Ernie Els. After an exciting day, head for dinner, drinks, and dancing at Dubai’s Marina District or visit the largest retail entertainment center on the planet at the Mall of the Emirates.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Nestling on the south-western coast of Paros, Villa Earvin is bathed in the dazzling light of the Mediterranean sun. Looking out over the island of Antiparos, this sensational villa encompasses the very best of Greek island living. From your manicured garden and stone terrace, you are just a short walk from an idyllic pebble beach. Closer to home you can dive in to your glorious turquoise pool against the backdrop of the glittering sea. As the crimson sun sets over the Aegean Sea you can unwind in the shaded pergola.

Villa Earvin is a blissful property in a breath-taking location. Built in traditional Cycladean-style it boasts impressive stone clad walls and acres of space. At its heart lies the magnificent iridescent swimming pool. Around the far edge of its inviting crystal clear waters you’ll find a stretch of sand where you can recline on a sun lounger. Next to the house itself you can soak up the sun on the stone terrace or escape to the sheltered verandas furnished with comfy chairs and a dining table.

Divided between the main house and two guest house bungalows, Villa Earvin is a welcoming, expansive host. You can dine al fresco in the sun-dappled pergola or inside at an elegant glass table. The villa’s interior is tastefully decorated in calming, muted shades and enhanced by clean and contemporary furnishings. Its sleek modern kitchen is embellished by soft pine surfaces. Designed to stylishly cater for comfort, Villa Earvin provides an uncluttered setting where you can simply relax.

The villa’s luxurious bedrooms provide you with cool, calm havens which will help soothe you to sleep. The master suite is the only bedroom in the main house and encompasses the entire upper floor. Here you can recline in your king-sized bed or take an invigorating shower in the gleaming en-suite before stepping out on to your private terrace. The remaining en-suite bedrooms are divided neatly between two bungalows. Each opens out on to the sunny lower terrace and, with a mixture of twin and double beds, give you total flexibility.

From Villa Earvin you can indulge yourself in a quintessential Paros vacation. You can laze away days lounging by your delightful pool or beachcombing on the secluded pebble beach. A short drive away you’ll find the attractive seaside village of Aliki. This picturesque port is renowned for its seafood restaurants and relaxed atmosphere. Close by it the Aegean winds provide ideal conditions for windsurfing and water sports.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Rest your arms on the edge of the infinity pool as the sun sinks into the ocean's horizon at this Cycladic-masterpiece on the rocky coast of Mykonos. Hop out of the pool to a lounge chair and use the day's last light to help warm up for an exciting evening. After an alfresco seafood dinner, rally the troops for a night of bar-hopping, dancing, and maybe a trip to the Mykonos Paradise Beach.

The Big Blue is a perfect example of ancient Cycladic architecture, showing off its soft edges, rounded corners, and arched-doorways. However, this modern version enjoys much more spacious interiors. Wander stone paths and curved hallways to find the perfect ocean-vantage point, a spot to curl up and read, or space to socialize with the group. Then, head outside to watch sailboats navigate the harbor.

On a quiet night in, Blue's long sofa and satellite TV pairs perfectly with a bowl of popcorn and a blanket. In the afternoon, spend a little time working on your tan from a sun lounger or find a shady spot on the terrace for a quick nap. If it's looking like it's going to be one of those nights, turn up the sound system and unleash your inner mixologist behind the terrace bar.

The first thing you'll want to do in Mykonos is wander the narrow alleys, lookouts, and stairways that make up this iconic hillside town. Surely you'll find a handful of bars, restaurants, and boutique shops to check out along the way. For dinner, sample traditional Greek seafood at AvliTou Thodori. In the mood to shop? Matogianni Street is the island's most busy market.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Take in the calm splendor of the Cyclades from this gorgeous villa located on Paros’s southern shore. Like the blue horizon beyond, the property utilizes open space and long, straight lines, paired with calming white colors. The villa’s seaview pool and huge stone rooms are moments from pristine beaches, the charming villages of Drios, plus an ancient Byzantine roadway with truly excellent views.

You will find yourself lingering over breakfast at Villa Selene, with the expansive view of the sea and the calm expanse of the Lolantonis countryside convincing you to stay put for one more tasty Greek coffee. Guests will love the gentle echo of footsteps on stone in the great rooms of the villa, with a huge amount of space giving the impression of the home as truly being part of the landscape. Wood and white paint personify the living room, complete with big, welcoming couches and top-tier entertainment system, while the breakfast bar and carved table afford fine functionality to the fully-equipped kitchen. Relax by the fresh and reviving pool in 1 of the artfully-designed sun recliners, or savor a satisfying fresh lunch of locally-sourced delicacies at the court-like dining terrace, where the afternoon shadows slowly revolve around the figures enjoying the sheer atmosphere of this villa.

Guests are situated amongst the unique calm and natural beauty of the island of Paros at Villa Selene. Just a short walk away are the sunlit sands of the Lolantonis beach, where guests can dive into the clearest of Mediterranean waters. Just a short drive provides access to hillside villages, where traditional Greek tavernas await with cool drinks and a fine choice of island cuisine. A ruined Byzantine road lies close by for walking excursions, offering views into the fascinating past of the island and seascape. Guests can enjoy quick access to cosmopolitan Athens via the close-by airport and other beautiful islands via the nearby ferry port.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
